discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Establish baseline metrics.

Explanation:

Establishing baseline metrics is the first step in improving network monitoring. A baseline represents the normal operating performance of the network, such as traffic patterns, bandwidth usage, and response times. By understanding what "normal" looks like, the administrator can more easily identify anomalies or performance issues when monitoring the network in the future.

questions.question_text: A network administrator needs to improve network monitoring. Which of the following should the administrator do first?
Which of the following attacks utilizes a network packet that contains multiple network tags?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. VLAN hopping 

A Layer 2 attack that enables an attacker to access hosts on a VLAN the attacker is not a part of. Traditionally this attack used switch spoofing or double tagging.

Selected Answer: B
Lets Goo Vlan Hop

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B: VLAN hopping

Selected Answer: C
C. Increase the scope size.

Explanation:

The issue is likely related to a shortage of available IP addresses in the DHCP scope. As more students arrive on campus, the demand for IP addresses increases. If the DHCP server’s scope (the range of IP addresses it can assign) is too small to accommodate all the devices, the server will not be able to assign IP addresses to new users. Increasing the DHCP scope size will allow the server to allocate more IP addresses, resolving the issue.

Selected Answer: C
More student came back to school so increasing the scope size of Ip addresses will help student connect to the network

questions.question_text: A network administrator is troubleshooting issues with a DHCP server at a university. More students have recently arrived on campus, and the users are unable to obtain an IP address. Which of the following should the administrator do to address the issue?
Which of the following is designed to distribute network traffic among devices based on the quantity of traffic?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. load balancing.
The process of taking several servers and making them look like a single server, spreading processing and supporting bandwidth needs

Selected Answer: B
B. Wrong VLAN assignment

Here’s why:

The user can access the internet (which likely requires external routing via a gateway) and can print (which could be local or via a networked printer in the same VLAN), but is unable to access server resources. This suggests the user has network connectivity but is possibly on the wrong VLAN.
Server resources are often restricted to specific VLANs, so if the user was moved to a port associated with a different VLAN, their device may no longer be able to reach the servers, especially if those resources are in a separate VLAN or subnet.

questions.question_text: A user recently moved a workstation to a different part of the office. The user is able to access the internet and print but is unable to access server resources. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the issue?
